paper.title: On Commitment and Cumulativity in Default Logics
paper.venue: European Conference on Symbolic and Quantitative Approaches to Reasoning and Uncertainty
paper.abstract: This paper examines Pooleu0027s notion of “commitment to assumptions” as well as Makinsonu0027s demand for cumulativity in the context of default logic. It provides a semantical characterization of Brewkau0027s approach which can be regarded as a realization of both notions. Moreover, another variant of default logic is introduced that shares the nice properties of Brewkau0027s variant but avoids some of its problems.
